snippet: Operating profit in corn processing was down $48 million from last year, to $74 million.
abstract: Corn processing company Archer Daniels Midland posts a 25 percent decline in quarterly profit, hurt by record corn prices and a decline in profit from its ethanol operations; company earned $284 million, or 43 cents a share, below the $381 million, or 58 cents a share, it earned a year ago; revenue slipped less than 1 percent to $22.68 billion from $22.87 billion a year earlier.
lead_paragraph: Operating profit in corn processing was down $48 million from last year, to $74 million.

headline.seo: Archer’s Profit Falls 25% on Losses in Ethanol
headline.main: Archer’s Profit Drops 25% on Losses in Ethanol Unit
headline.print_headline: Archer’s Profit Drops 25% on Losses in Ethanol Unit
